newsitem.title: CANADA: Alberta harvest stalls on up to nine inches snow.
newsitem.headline: Alberta harvest stalls on up to nine inches snow.

text.p: Alberta's harvest stalled at 49 percent completed due to rain, snow and frost in the week ended Oct 4.
As much as nine inches of snow fell in some parts of Alberta as harvest stalled at 49 percent complete, compared to the 10-year average of 81 percent done by this date.
About 31 percent of hard red spring wheat should grade as No1 Canada Western Red Spring, compared to 29 percent in the 10-year average, AWP said in its weekly crop report.
Thirteen percent should grade No2 CWRS, versus 24 percent. Twenty eight percent should grade No3 CWRS, versus 30 percent.
Twenty eight percent should grade as feed wheat compared to 16 percent in the 10-year average.

Twenty percent of barley should grade as malt, versus 13 percent in the 10-year average, 66 percent should grade as No1 Canada Western feed barley, versus 71 percent and 14 percent should grade as No2 CW, versus 16 percent.
Seventy nine percent of canola should grade as No1 Canada versus 72 percent in the 10-year average, 16 percent as No2 C versus 17 percent, four percent as No3 C versus seven percent.
The extent of crop damage was not yet known.
